website_summaries.verdict: The compact Nikon Coolpix S9300 is a good choice for anyone after a pure point-and-shoot experience and a long zoom lens. But, depending on needs, you might want to wait for a price drop.
pros: The Nikon Coolpix S9300 has fast shooting performance, a wide, long lens in a pocketable body, and several fun and useful shooting modes that help you get the best shot without much effort
cons: Competing models from Canon and Panasonic have longer lenses and more shooting options for the same suggested retail price and the S9300's photos aren't the sharpest when viewed at larger sizes

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This has a couple buttons loose so it is impossible to change settings on it. It also doesn't take consistently clear, focused pictures. (I've had this camera before, it broke so I took a chance on a used one) It was advertised as great condition, too. A bit deceiving.
customer_reviews.author: thenewAteam2019

customer_reviews.title: I've been using a Nikon Coolpix S6500 for years and totally love it, it's small and takes great pictures
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because I wanted the GPS feature. I've been using a Nikon Coolpix S6500 for years and totally love it, it's small and takes great pictures. I expected the same out of this. This is larger, clunkier, doesn't fit in my shirt pocket, pictures are not quite as sharp as the S6500 and the GPS takes time to find satellites, I feel stupid waving it around my head as they suggest for it to find the satellites.
customer_reviews.author: Laura M

customer_reviews.title: Very unimpressed both with construction quality and picture quality
customer_reviews.text: Battery/card door doesn't have an effective detent so the door opens on occasion. Autofocus works most the time, though sometimes it just can't seem to get it right. One of the reasons I went with this model was I expected the GPS data to be included in the exif photo file. Even with the GPS logging running, the location coordinates don't later show up in the photo info (iphoto 09), Camera reports no A-GPS file on the card, so I'm guessing the satellite almanac isn't available and even after leaving it outside with a clear view of the sky, it still doesn't have the almanac. Maybe if you are willing to use the included software, you'd have better luck.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera, and it is the third Coolpix I have owned. I used to have a big expensive camera and very expensive lens for business purposes to capture a whole room view, and this camera can do what my $1,000 wide angle lens did. Great clarity with video and photos, many choices on so many things! The only downfall is that I have not taken the time to study, learn and memorize everything it actually can do. This one can also fit into almost any purse, and so easy to transport!
customer_reviews.author: M. Bohn

customer_reviews.title: Solid camera, slightly larger than expected, would prefer external charger
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use menu, good optics (depth of field). Very long lens and good wide angle. Moderate amount of configurability in options. The only downsides as I see it are that: -No external charger - batteries have to be charged within the camera (not convenient if you want to have more than one battery and swap), unlike my Panasonic Lumix cameras. -The body is larger than the comparable Canon and Panasonic. The flash on this pops up as needed. Where my hand naturally falls on the body my finger covers up the flash - keeping it from popping up. Not a real problem - but something you have to get used to which is different from comparable models.
customer_reviews.author: Fish

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Pocket Camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this when my old digital camera broke. It has high resolution, a great optical zoom, and once I got familiar with the focus settings, I have really enjoyed having it with me almost all the time. I get great pictures of landscapes and wildlife, have got some great low light shots and enjoy the small size compared to DSLR cameras with coarser density. It does not have a manual shutter setting, which would be nice, and Nikon has already replaced it with a different model that has more features. I consider it a good purchase, and am pleased with almost all the shots I take with it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Warren

customer_reviews.title: Blurred Lines
customer_reviews.text: Great camera if you can spend hours learning about settings and take a photography course online. Otherwise pictures are always blurry you can't use autofocus like other point and shoot cameras and expect good clear pictures. So I just take a bunch of pics and play with different settings and occasionally get a decent shot. Video works great. Honestly, this camera takes so many bad blurry pictures I get better shots with camera phones
customer_reviews.author: SMOKIN' JOE

customer_reviews.title: Such a deal!
customer_reviews.text: So far, I'm not disappointed in the quality and handiness of the Nikon S9200. It captures images with great sharpness, which was the complaint I had with a point-and-shoot made by Canon that also came through Amazon. I like the large screen, the instant availability of HD Video (for when that alien spacecraft hovers over my house), and the feel of quality. I set the self-timer and placed the camera on a solid surface in very dim lighting conditions. After watching it think and take a long exposure, i was amazed at the results. As a long-time Leica user, I am quite satisfied with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: SirGeorge

customer_reviews.title: NO owner's manual in ENGLISH!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used mine much. Have a trip planned for the coming week and this camera was recommended to me as easy to use and great pictures. Received order as promised and it was packaged great. HOWEVER, if I want an owner's manual in ENGLISH I have to go online and download and print the 244 pages!!! I did however receive the owner's manual in 20+ other languages. So frustrated!!! First time I've wished I had not ordered from Amazon and had purchased from an electronics store.
customer_reviews.author: Gail H

customer_reviews.title: Nikon COOLPIX S9300
customer_reviews.text: Camera works great and pix are great! The inconvenience I found is with the 'POP UP' flash. Many times I find my finger holding it down because it does not pop up until the the button is pressed to take the photo. I'm still trying to get accustomed to keeping my finger out of the way because that is where holding the camera feels most natural. If the pop up release allowed the flash to extend when powering up the camera, then there would not be a problem, for me anyway! I do recommend this camera if you like to enlarge your photos.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth E Huffaker

customer_reviews.title: First impressions.
customer_reviews.text: Overall impression is very positive. Pictures seem to be very colorful and sharp. Have not checked them on bigger screen yet, though. Zoom is good, although focusing at the max zoom is slow/unreliable. Some minor details that felt wrong are the position of the flash (I'm used to holding the camera with my left hand and the flash tries to pop up from underneath of my left index finger now), a little too long of a delay between pressing the video record button and actually starting/stopping video recording, and a little too long time between shots (I guess saving those 16 MPixel pics takes too long).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Joan Harris of cameras
customer_reviews.text: A little heavier than need be, it is yet efficient and does a great job. It is packed with goodies - 18x zoom, good battery, lotsa storage, 16megpix, HD video, a gps location finder, and easy to use controls. Like most of its size, it does not have a viewfinder so you have to mess with the fixed, uncovered display that cannot compete with bright sunlight or objects to scratch it. As cellphones get better cameras, cameras have to get better to justify carrying the extra object. This is worth the effort fersur.
customer_reviews.author: GT Jeff Cherer

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera as temporary replacement for a broken Fuji. Took it on vacation and I am stunned at the quality of the pictures . Even I a dark nightclub, it showed colors in hd. The flash is capable. I am keeping this baby. My brother took it on vacation and is under threat of harm if it is not returned. Especially great with the sdxc memory card. Get the extra batteries if you intend to take a lot of videos. Only down is the slow processor even in bright daylight. was worth the money. Hope they have a new model. will look into that.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: a good compromise
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine camera for the money, but I don't have much luck with the image stabilization feature. I take a lot blurry photos to get one that is acceptable. I've also noticed that all of the new digital cameras I've purchased in the past 5 years take pictures that are inferior to those taken with the old Nikon Coolpix 3.2 megapixel. I suspect the old lenses were better quality - maybe glass instead of plastic. The size of the camera is a good compromise: just small enough to fit reasonably in a purse, but still a pretty good zoom.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Nice but has little things I don't like.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is very similar to the Fuji F770 except for the GPS which is on the S9300. The thing I like is the dynamic range of the pictures. I don't like the flash that pops up in some modes any time in low light. I harder to handle than the Fuji and the mode selector is so easy to change that it changes just with a nudge of your finger. Like I was at the cemetery doing findagrave stuff and I had changed the mode from auto to soft mode. If you want good picture though it is not a bad buy, and really what is a camera for anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Audiomook

customer_reviews.title: Great for outdoor pictures
customer_reviews.text: We bought these cameras for our daughters who have a small photography business. They're great for outdoor pictures and have some fun features like color filtering. I don't like that you have to plug them into the wall to charge them. It would be nice to be able to have extra batteries like we do for our other Nikon. We can just pop in a fresh battery while the other is charging. It limits us when we go on vacations where electricity is at a minimum. I would also prefer to have the option of the smaller view finder in addition to the large screen.
customer_reviews.author: Just your basic

customer_reviews.title: SEMI PRO CAMERA dirt cheap
customer_reviews.text: I have a CANON G 10, and had a DSLR outfit, two bodies, five lenses, a big bag, until I foisted the suitcase on my daughter and her husband. I now have two cameras with viewfinders and accessory hot shoes and super lenses and internal electronics and they are both (very sophisticated) point and shoot cameras. Heavy compared with the less sophisticated P&S cameras out, but that is nothing considering the full range of pictures and lens/picture quality. Awesome camera, totally competitive with the G10.
customer_reviews.author: C. J. Clavadetscher

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad.
customer_reviews.text: The product is OK as they described, but Nikon product has less function than canon. I don't know why sometime the picture were blur, but we still use the 16 MP camera now. Recently,with other customer's question, I found my camera package does not have the cable use to connect between camera and wall charger. Be careful, when you buy this camera,should looking at the package thoroughly,don't missing something like me.I did send a message now, and waiting for the seller's feedback. Update: *:The company send to the missing cable in two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Will not focus anymore.
customer_reviews.text: I only used this camera twice! Then, when I tried to use it a third time, it will not focus at all. According to the forums that are out on the web, Nikon has a lot of issues with this. Not only with my s9200 model. But with most common Coolpix models. But I was smart a purchased a two year replacement warranty. I am only 7 months into the warranty, so I will be looking to get something else.
customer_reviews.author: Lonestar 38

customer_reviews.title: but it was easily solved by slightly pressing down on the button that ...
customer_reviews.text: I am not a photographer. I noticed the blurring issue, but it was easily solved by slightly pressing down on the button that takes the pictures to refocus the lens. I have taken some beautiful pictures with this camera. I needed a camera with a decent zoom that wasn't too expensive. The more I play around with it the better the pictures become. I will say that I constantly want to press the wrong button to take a picture, but I'm retraining myself to move my finger up and to the left.
customer_reviews.author: Sara McClure

customer_reviews.title: W O W
customer_reviews.text: Great Photos always, this is the best one I have used since Digital started. This camera gives great photos in all environments, Just have a tripod available to get great Night shots, the clarity is astounding and near perfect color rendition. Easy yo operate and shoots in a hurry so you do not miss the moment. Video is good with the HDMI output directly from camera to watch on any size screen. I use a DSLR but this camera is pocket size so it goes every where!
customer_reviews.author: mitchradio

customer_reviews.title: very clear pictures and movies
customer_reviews.text: this is about my 5 HD movie camera and 4 16 mega pixel camera and it works just like is should I did have to return 2 fujis F600 because they could not focus ever which was very disappointing to me since I liked that camera had Fuji before which worked great I also had a Nikon before and that is why I bought another one the price was very good since its a model that is most likely going away which is fine with me I am very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: fortlaud1

customer_reviews.title: Great camera but Nikon claims it is Gray Market!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great. Does great video, zoom, and photos. Only issues I have is charging is via a non standard USB cable, while charging the camera has to be off. I would advise ordering one of the extra external battery chargers and extra battery. Also when I went to register on nikon website it told me my serial number was "Gray Market" which messes with warranty. See here [...] Also: You can hear the zoom and focus on videos, and it often has focus issues during a video.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Fahmie

customer_reviews.title: All it does is take pictures
customer_reviews.text: I've had a smart phone for years but want a camera to take on vacation. I wanted a camera that uses AA batteries but when I chose the GPS option for this camera (I think) it came with a rechargeable lithium battery. Grrrrr. I can't figure out how to use it but I'm 65 years old so that may have something to do with it. I have to find a kid to show me. The photos are good quality for the limited times I've used it so far. I just wish I could send from it.
customer_reviews.author: Marianne Greenfield

customer_reviews.title: Good enough!
customer_reviews.text: I read all reviews of this product in Amazon before I decided to buy. Later I found some of the complaints are not my concern. e.g., some says it doesn't focus when zoom, but my experience is it does, though take a little bit longer. Also the power button and flush position do not bother me either. I like this product and it has more functions (shot model) than I use at this time - I am still learning. By the way, the full HD video quality is very good too.
customer_reviews.author: Jian Su

customer_reviews.title: Intuitive and easy to master
customer_reviews.text: I Took this camera to Australia and New Zealand about a week after I purchased it. This camera is usable in a very intuitive manner. I took over 1200 photos during a twelve day period down under. Of those 1200 photos (of course many near duplicates) taken under a variety of different conditions, I have almost 400 photos that consider to be worth the price of the trip and the camera combined. The videos were simply a handy bonus...all 40 of them. Very nice pocket sized camera.
customer_reviews.author: Keen Observer

customer_reviews.title: S9300 camera
customer_reviews.text: Again it was a Christmas present to myself, Have not used it yet. It was shipped on time packaged well and looks good until I see how the pictures come out I will not be able to be more forthcoming then that. My nieces have several of the cameras in the Coolpix series and are very happy with them I see no reason to believe I will be less happy with mine, it is just the instruction manual is so thick, it may be awhile before I get thru it to take any pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Karl

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is the 1st camera I've bought in quite some time, so far I have only utilized some basic features. I have to say it takes amazing pictures, it's very fast, and the zoom is awesome. For just over a hundred bucks you really can't go wrong. Other similar models are much hiugher (9300) for GPS feature only which wasn't even something I wanted. I was looking for a great quality camera with excellent zoom, and didn't want to spend a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: BasicTek

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY think I don't like is the popup flash.
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, great zoom, great mega pixels, great pictures. The ONLY think I don't like is the popup flash. I hadn't noticed it when I was buying the camera on Amazon. I feel like it's going to break, and sometimes it pops and startles you... Sometimes if I'm holding the camera on that side, my hand interferes with it popping up. I just wish the flash was built in like the other bunch of digital cameras I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: Camera is okay, glad I got a good price or I would be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed with this camera the first time I used it. All the pictures were coming out blurry. We played around with the settings a bit & now it takes clear pictures. I think the camera should have came "ready to use". I should not of had to play with the settings in order to get a clear picture. I also don't like were the flash pops up. I always for get & my finger gets in the way. But it is a good camera despite these flaws. I will get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: KJTsmama

customer_reviews.title: Horrible autofocus in low light.
customer_reviews.text: We were looking for a camera that could go the distance literally. With generous zoom, this Nikon feels good, easy to see display and best of all, has a dedicated movie button. This was important to us because we have a newborn in our family. Update Returned this camera to Amazon. The autofocus is horrible in low light. Every picture was fuzzy and disappointing. I am surprised that Nikon would put there name on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Grandpa

customer_reviews.title: Good price for Good camera
customer_reviews.text: At the Gold box price deal it is a good purchase. Do not like the confusing menu setting under "effect". Anti-vibration functonality could be better. Rest is OK and pictures are nice. Like the optical zoom capability very much. Normally use a EOS 5D semi-professional camera with 12 MP, but this 16MP makes nice walking around shots if you do not want to carry the 10 pound camera and lenses with you.
customer_reviews.author: Bear grills survival gerber

customer_reviews.title: Telephoto lens mechanism gets hung up.
customer_reviews.text: The problem with these type of cameras is the telescoping lenses. I 've had several of these cameras. After a while the telescoping mechanism get stuck when trying to retract into the camera body. Otherwise the pics are pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: terre brown

customer_reviews.title: One of the better point and shoots
customer_reviews.text: Having had a couple of other brands, such as Panasonic and Sony, this is my favorite. Easy to use, menu is not complicated, really not much to dislike. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars, is that on occasion, some photos are soft, however this is a common 'problem' with many brands of point and shoot cameras once in awhile. Given that is not an SLR, I think this is an excellent product, and I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: SEAL2

customer_reviews.title: As Expected (2nd try)
customer_reviews.text: First camera charged up but then would not stay on. Froze up. Ttried reboots, battery change but no help. Distributor immediately took it back and sent another B4 the original was returned. Second camera works as planned and expected. Hopefully no need for another. Used for recording information for inspections and shipping at a MFG company.
customer_reviews.author: John H Barnhart

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I got it on Cyber Monday at a TERRIFIC price. Best camera I've ever had. Sounds like some people just got "lemons" or should have paid more for an even better camera. I think this is solid. Takes great pics, easy to use. Love the close-up macro lens. And on my Mac I like that I don't have to drag to trash to eject it as usb. I can just unplug it without getting that annoying alert message.
customer_reviews.author: L_Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: It's a good little point-and-shoot with a very good 18x optical lens.
customer_reviews.text: I have used it quite a lot since I got it, and overall, I like it. There are a couple of things that are, to me, less than ideal. First, the flash has to pop up from the camera body to be used. I've taken a lot of underexposed pictures simply because the fingers holding the left side of the camera were keeping the flash from popping up. Second, there is a fairly long lag between pressing the button and actually taking the picture. That means action shots are almost impossible. But I have taken a lot of really good pictures with it, and it's relatively easy to understand and use. Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas E. Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: The S9200 Nikon camera is a great value for all the features you receive. The quality is as good as any I have seen in a non SLR camera. The user controls are easy to locate and understand. The features give you everything you need including great video along with the best MP level for this type of camera. The camera also has a great zoom, again one of the best in a non SLR or changeable lens camera. Excellent for a point and shoot camera, easy to carry. I would recommend this to anyone including professionals who want a point and shoot camera.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Melton

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Working in 10 Months
customer_reviews.text: Not a great camera in the 1st place, but ok then stopped charging correctly and not able to use. It appeared to be a good deal for 130$ however I thought it might last longer. I had a charging problem with a previous Nikon and new batteries didn't solve the problem. I know Nikon's are suppose to be good, but my Kodak's have lasted longer. I would advise against getting this camera, but not sure of what to suggest.
customer_reviews.author: B. W. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Disapointed
customer_reviews.text: Takes a great picture which is expected from Nikon but is not all that easy to use. Flash location sucks. The preset picture mode dial on the back does not have a fast action/motion feature on it. I was at a parade where costumed people where on stilts and moving very quickly by me because of there long strides. Without that feature none of those pictures turned out descent. I should have stayed with the Canon Easy Share like I had before.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Luepke

customer_reviews.title: Excellent point & shoot cam
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed with all the HD pictures I took with this camera. Not sure why other people gave this cam poor rating, but when I read some of the reviews of the people who sounded like they know what they were talking about, I thought it was worth a try for that price. And I'm glad I did. I own a Canon DSLR camera and this is a great purse size camera to carry around without having to worry about picture quality.
customer_reviews.author: Cielo Enviado

customer_reviews.title: Easy camera to use for any skill level
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Coolpix camera. I'm a realtor and this is a perfect camera for taking pics. Love the rechargeable battery. Keep it in my car it charges easily with the USB charger. Can also plug right into my computer or pop the camera card in for quick and easy transfer.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Andrews

customer_reviews.title: takes nice pictures and is small enough to carry around without ...
customer_reviews.text: takes nice pictures and is small enough to carry around without any trouble. I dislike the spinning setting button/disc. It is right where you hold the camera and is so very easy to move. I have ruined many once in a life time pictures by not knowing I have "bumped" it and changed a setting. Otherwise I have been pretty happy with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nikon coolpx
customer_reviews.text: Great camera, great price. This camera takes great pictures, portraits land scapes. Two issues, when you turn it on. Your hand easily blocks the flash, so you have to be carful how you hold it. Secondly, you need to either read the manual or practice shootings learning the Iso's and settings. Or you can just put it in auto focus and shoot. Professional shots right out of the box!
customer_reviews.author: Star grazer

customer_reviews.title: amazing picture quality and the zoom is incredible
customer_reviews.text: I've read reviews on here saying it takes too long to start up and load to take a picture/focus. Well truthfully it does take like 3 or 4 seconds but to me that really does not matter. If you are going on trips demanding fast picture taking you should probably buy a professional grade camera. But if you are just going to use this as a normal everyday camera it's awesome. The video is an incredible 1080p and capturing videos playing them back is great.
customer_reviews.author: Biff

customer_reviews.title: Not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Dislike this camera so much that I actually never use it. Takes forever to actually take the picture and the flash is in a horrible spot, where you can't help buy accidentely tie it up with your finger holding the camera. Tried to return it after realizing that, but I was one day late on Amazon's return policy. I had received the camera, but hadn't used it until weeks later.
customer_reviews.author: Stephany

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: Have identical unit. This camera has eratic software changes and you don't know what results to expect. Bad unit.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Leon Mainer

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly good camera at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: I have to be honest. This is a fantastic camera. I absolutely love it...but I've hardly used it since I got a phone that takes stunning photos. I will certainly be making every effort to get more use out of this camera because it is so exceptionally good. I feel as though I've neglected it.
customer_reviews.author: DannyA3579

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a better Nikon for my trip to Italy, and this camera was great. High quality video and pictures, including in low light. As you'll frequently see noted, the position of the pop up flash can be irritating, but that's the only flaw I can see. It was a great upgrade from my previous Nikon Cool Pix and helped me capture some great memories of Italy!
customer_reviews.author: Martha

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and very rugged.
customer_reviews.text: Slips into my shirt pocket easily, making it easy to keep handy for that sudden picture opportunity. I was taking pictures of our new puppy chasing the ball, when unnoticed by me it must have slid out of my pocket onto the ground. I didn't find it until the next day. After carefully brushing the dirt and sand off, it started up just fine, and still takes great pictures. I now hook the lanyard through a button when exercising with the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Donald V. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Cough up the extra $ and buy a Canon
customer_reviews.text: Within first couple of months, camera shuts off with lens still open. Have had a number of "non view-able" files on my camera card even though I've only used this camera card with this camera. Resolution of viewfinder is poor. Camera is pretty big, bulky, and heavy. Overall, very dissatisfied with this product. I bought it for my gf and have only used it for an hour or so and this is my quick review :( Wish I had a chance to play with it within the first month of buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: He found it easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Hubby loves this- was a gift! He found it easy to use, good quality and quality pictures. would recommend based on his experiences.
customer_reviews.author: La

customer_reviews.title: Good for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: I like this camera, but there are a few things that keep it from being a top-rated one. First, there seems to be too much "stuff". I mean, there seems to be lots of settings and all that, but it's too much to remember. Also, I can't seem to get a fast shutter speed. If the subject is moving, it blurs, even outside. And I don't mean "action", just normal movements. I probably need to try more settings, but the absence of manual controls is annoying.
customer_reviews.author: fRANK jAHRLING

customer_reviews.title: Great zoom and extras on camera
customer_reviews.text: The 18x zoom is great, but sometimes photos are fuzzy if you're trying to zoom in on something small, like a bird far away. But other times I've had great luck with the zoom and the photos. I like the extras you can add after a photo is taken, such as fisheye and star cross. This camera is also good for close ups. However, it is not very fast at focusing, so you may lose some shots if something happens fast. I haven't used the feature for speed yet. I really like the camera, the photos are clear and crisp, the colors are perfect. The problems are probably user error on my part.
customer_reviews.author: kmc

customer_reviews.title: Random image quality
customer_reviews.text: Expected more from Nikon, you can get some good pictures out of the S9200, but results are not reliable. There is too much noise even at low ISO settings, flash pics come up over-exposed most of the times. Video is rather fine though. Bottom line, I'm looking for another camera.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos P

customer_reviews.title: Really a nice cam for the buck!
customer_reviews.text: I lucked out, and caught this on sale. It's a great piece of equipment. I've only used it a few times so far, but I am very happy with the results of the photos I've taken. And, with the purchase of the accessory kit, (I mentioned in another rating), it was definitely an awesome purchase and product.
customer_reviews.author: Fenton B Slaughter

customer_reviews.title: Camera took 5 pictures and died each day
customer_reviews.text: They say never go on vacation with new shoes and a new camera. Now I know why. Camera battery would look full and then took about 5 pictures before it died each day. Each night I charged the camera. Each morning the battery was full and after 5 pictures it went to half life and then died. I ended up using my smart phone for the rest of the trip.
customer_reviews.author: For What it is Worth...

customer_reviews.title: Still cannot figure it out
customer_reviews.text: It is complicated to learn by yourself if you have never had a digital camera before. it is way too small and I should have gotten one that is easier to hold and handle. Pic quality, I do not know yet, I hope to learn soon. it is so small that I .do not think it will be useful for me, maybe a woman with smaller hands.
customer_reviews.author: Jetman

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for one daughter she loved it so much I bought another one for another daughter. Has great zoom capabilities and the picture resolution is brilliant. Best value for the price! The first one I bought through Best Buy, I got the second one through Amazon (not too much difference in price) but the camera was delivered quickly and without a hitch! Made Christmas shopping very convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Compact, simple to use!
customer_reviews.text: Fits right in my purse! Great low light photos! No trouble with zoom clarity. The flash is in an awkward position where I would normally place my pointer finger when shooting a photo, but I can live with it! The camera is simpe to use. Would definitely recommend this camera for friends wanting a small, nice camera.
customer_reviews.author: holtster

customer_reviews.title: Another great Nikon
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Nikon's for years, and used their SLR cameras for years. I know have a D5100 DSLR, and wanted something to carry around when I didn't want to carry the DSLR. This is great. The quality is amazing for a point and shoot, and the GPS is fun when using it with lightroom or iPhoto.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I think this is a great camera. The features delivers and are fun to play with. I didn't realize that aperture cannot be fiddled with until I read the manual. I bought this camera as a beginner's camera, but I found my options for manual settings to be very limited. Not really complaining though. I think I got a great deal. I get to practice the fundamentals and basics (and figure out how much I actually enjoy photography) before I invest in something better.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Camera!!
customer_reviews.text: I was undecided whether to buy a Nikon or Sony, I am fond of Sony products, but also I was knowledge that Nikon was good too. I bought this camera and I am pleased. The image on the screen very sharp, has automatic scenes that fit to the environment, real stereo sound, 18x objective that captures distant images with excellent sharpness.
customer_reviews.author: A. Reyes

customer_reviews.title: Warranty is through purchaser vs. Nikon for premium priced camera
customer_reviews.text: Don't like the idea that the warranty is through the purchaser vs. Nikon. No warranty card/information present in box. Paid premium price for this discontinued model, but no Nikon warranty?
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: An alright camera
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional by any means but I like this camera for the most part. My only real (and biggest) issue is that I got this camera specifically because I wanted to be able to take pictures of moving people and subjects without much blur, I got the opposite with this. Even taking a picture of an inanimate object comes out blurry no matter what setting I try. Maybe it's something I'm doing wrong but I've tried everything. Otherwise not a bad camera but like I said, I'm not a professional so I don't use it professionally and can't vouch for specs or anything really.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay

customer_reviews.title: BLURRY!!!! PICS everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: day, night, sports, etc you will go home and transfer the pics to your PC to notice your camera ruined your picture!!!!! this is the worst camera i ever had and guys, PLEASE DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA
customer_reviews.author: Alvaro

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry in my purse, easy to use, I own a bigger all out Nikon witch I love but hard to have on me all the time so I wanted something small to have with me all the time love Nikon so went with this one, so far so good takes great pics and love that I can zoom in and get the other shots, great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: Slow and painful
customer_reviews.text: Camera takes great pictures, so I gave it 2 stars. Other than that, I really dislike this camera. I have to push the power button 2-3 times before it turns on so I have missed multiple picture opportunities. I'm usually in such a panic at that point that I forget about the pop-up flash and it gets stuck under my finger. The top dial that changes the picture type also tuns very easily (like a finger bumping it) and the next picture inevitably ends up in the wrong exposure.
customer_reviews.author: W.O.W

customer_reviews.title: coolpix
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I am doing anything wrong, but this camera does not focus that well. I feel that there is some kind of setting that I am missing to set it up so it takes a clear picture. I have a Canon that takes the perfect picture every time. I thought I would try the Nikon due to the great reviews. I wish I could send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Scrapbook Mom

customer_reviews.title: Nice Camera!
customer_reviews.text: As with any new eletronics it takes a bit of getting used to all the various setting and abilities of this camera but I could not be happier. great pictures inside and out. nice big viewer screen on back and impressive zoom. great macro setting and a couple cool effects. really nice point and shoot camera.
customer_reviews.author: SGibbs

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Our S8100 bit the dust in the Gulf of Mexico, so we had to get a new camera. Basically, this camera is the same one, just upgraded with a larger screen, 16 MP instead of 12, and 18X zoom instead of 10X. They also redesigned the power button and thumb grip. Over all, a very nice update and it was actually 60 bucks cheaper this time.
customer_reviews.author: A. Page

customer_reviews.title: This has been working well and has useful features that are helpful
customer_reviews.text: This has been working well and has useful features that are helpful. Occasionally the flash lags, or the focus hangs and it gets a bad image, hard to remember where some settings are, but it has mostly been a great camera.
customer_reviews.author: 00Buckshot

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great point and shoot camera. The only issue is that at high zoom it is difficult to hold steady. Enlarged prints come out beautiful. Most of my pictures are animals or landscapes. I highly recommend this camera. The price is very reasonable for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jim W.

customer_reviews.title: VERSITILE CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding features. I use this camera a lot...took it all over Europe with me. Takes excellent photos/videos and can modify each without removing the CARD.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flash location
customer_reviews.text: Don't like the placement of the popup flash. Located where you naturally place your finger to take pictures. I am probably better suited to purchase something like this at the store where I can try before I buy Lots of features I probably won't use ....really just wanted simple point and shoot
customer_reviews.author: Jdub

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It's an excellent little thing, got it for my boyfriend for Christmas. Takes gorgeous photos. You'll love it as long as 1. you are aware that the flash is in a counter-intuitive spot, there is nothing wrong with this placement it just means you need to move your finger [I don't understand reviewers who score a product badly based on where they like sticking their fingers on a device, get over it and move your finger haha] 2. you don't have shaky hands, because we had an issue with blur at first [No camera is going to take great photos while you shimmy around though so again, user issue] 3. you are aware of your lighting. Have fun!!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Rayburn

customer_reviews.title: Nice and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little camera to use for on the go pictures. I've been taking great photos with it since I received it. The camera is easy to use and takes good photos of people and landscapes. The auto exposure has been quite good so far and has not required to much work in Photoshop. The photos transfer into Nikontansfer or Photoshop without any issues. This is a good camera for the money. But, I'm not giving up my DSLR yet.
customer_reviews.author: Mosey

customer_reviews.title: Coolpix s9200
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this camera through amazon warehouse and received it when expected. Took it to Washington D.C. and got some really good photos. The zoom is sharp but recommend a tripod when using extreme zoom. Overall this is a great pocket camera and would recommend it to anyone who does not like carrying a large camera when you know you will be walking alot.
customer_reviews.author: photobug

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I have taken this camera on several trips and I love how compact it is as well as the picture quality! My only complaint is with my sunglasses on, the screen turns black when the camera is turned to portrait... weird. I love Nikon products and will continue to buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Piper425

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought me this camera for valentines day!!! And I love it it takes great pics has a lot of different settings and is a beautiful red color I have another Nikon camera which is much bigger both are great cameras and both are beautiful red color.......Thanks Nikon for great products :)
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie R.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful point and shoot camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this product alot more than my previous Nikon. This thing takes some really, fantastic pictures and it's easy to use and super fun to just play with. My only "gripe" about his camera is the flash doesn't always pop up when you turn on the camera all in all it's a good camera.
customer_reviews.author: RocknRollGal109

customer_reviews.title: Not Nikon quality
customer_reviews.text: The price was irresitible, Thought I use it as an emergency portable with a great zoom (I am a Nikon only user series 50....) but the picture quality does not live up to the expectation of the Nikon Brand. I guess a large zoom never works that well.
customer_reviews.author: masami

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera!
customer_reviews.text: I chose this product because it was half off and I desperately wanted a digital camera because mine got broken. The only thing I'm not overly thrilled about is how long it takes to start up once you turn it on. But it's a big step up from my older Nikon camera. It's awesome and makes me very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Beth C

customer_reviews.title: Best Digital Camera I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: Great price, excellent camera, easy to use. The size is comfortable to use and carry. Instruction manual easy to use. Had to get use initially to the pop up flash since I was used to putting my finger on the top of the camera. Other than that, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Christy

customer_reviews.title: Nice for Engineering / Production Documentation
customer_reviews.text: We have two, our Plant Foreman dropped one so now one; we share it throughout the company and everyone likes it because it does a good job and has an easy to understand menu. Short movie clips are great for relaying information to each other too.
customer_reviews.author: Rakdren

customer_reviews.title: Nikon COOLPIX S9300
customer_reviews.text: Excellent camera for the price. Only thing that could be better is the location of the flash. When the flash is activated it is on the top to the far left where you place your left index finger. Takes excellent pictures and has a great zoom. I would recommend to all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: Bo Williams

customer_reviews.title: great pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying camera now after having for three months. Yes the flash pop up can be annoying but you get use to it. T he best part is all fun tricks it has in editing. My 10 yr old thinks it is the coolest to use. Pictures come out great!
customer_reviews.author: famof5

customer_reviews.title: Great for a PHD (push here dummy) or more advanced user
customer_reviews.text: I am the PHD taker and my husband loves to work with all of the settings. Great for the both of us. And it is compact enough to go in my husbands's pocket, or in my smaller travel bag. Wouldn't be without it. We upgraded from the S9100 and there was little additional learning curve. Love It!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed announcement did not report that it was a used item.
customer_reviews.text: I have really bought that camera thinking it was a new product. I received the camera and, for my surprise, I realized that it was an used camera and moreover the general conditions were not really good. There are some scratches on the LCD screen and unfortunately, there is dust and sand over its body and lens. Disappointed announcement did not report that it was a used item. Amazon intervened and returned part of the value of this item.
customer_reviews.author: Paulino Vidal

customer_reviews.title: New camara
customer_reviews.text: My new Nikon is totally satisfactory for my needs. Of course it is not SLR, but for a compact camera is very good. Takes great close-up pictures, great panoramic futures. Over all I am very satisfied with this unit. My previous camera Canon, was good, but Nikon is better. Battery life is much longer. It is small enough that I can carry in my pocket. I am completely satisfied. Thank you Nikon for making something affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Ucieklak

customer_reviews.title: Nikon
customer_reviews.text: I chose this camera because of the name brand Nikon which is one of the best cameras in existance. The quality of the pictures are amazing and never fails to give you that crisp, perfect color in the photos. I would recommend this camera to anyone and it is very convenient to carry with you on vacation.
customer_reviews.author: Norma L

customer_reviews.title: great images, but nothing that great for the size
customer_reviews.text: a little more bulky than desired. great images, but nothing that great for the size. better off with a single shot camera
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it. I bought this to compensate/replace the broken ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I bought this to compensate/replace the broken one for my customer. So far, there is only positive compliments about this camera. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the money
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this camera. It has everything you'd need at this price point. I did a lot of research on the competition and this seemed like the best value for the money. 2 gripes: - When doing multiple shots it takes a little bit of time to record the image which means if there is another shot you want to take quickly, then your outta luck. - Your finger naturally rests on top of where the flash pops up. You take the pic and it says it cant cos the flash is malfunctioning. Hmmm. That's a design flaw for user experience. But I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Brunton

customer_reviews.title: Nikon S9200
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera. The only difference between it and the Nikon S9300 is the S9200 does noy have GPS, or the additional cost for having it. I bought the for $140... not bad for a 16mp 18x zoom with a large CMOS sensor and ad a 900k dot monitor. Pictures out side are no problem, but inside in lower light the camera seems to have a bit of trouble getting focused, even with the focus assist beam enabled. It is a bit more compact than I thought, sof if you have large hands or prefer a camera of substantive size, keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: tim weisse

customer_reviews.title: Good Camera to own
customer_reviews.text: The Nikon Coolpix S9300 has so for taken very good pictures. As I am not use to having the flash located in the position that it has been placed on this camera, It will take a little time for me to get accustomed to it, but I am happy with this item so far.
customer_reviews.author: Donovan

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great
customer_reviews.text: Pics and settings are fine, but i found its gets slow in taking lots of pics in sequence. Basically, the time it takes to get to snap the next picture. Sometimes when turning it on, it doesn't want to focus, and you have to tap the shutter button to get it to clear up. All in all, i've had much better cameras that were cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: vman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing camera!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is astonishing. It has a solid body that confers a professional aspect as well a firm grip. Zoom is incredible for this class of cameras, and video/audio capabilities are more than enough for the amateur. Extremely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Stefano E.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this
customer_reviews.text: It's a piece of s***. Better pics with your phone. If you want to capture life/family moments, you're better off sketching them alla Reading Rainbow. I don't want to take four years of photography classes to know how to work a camera. I can only hope that this type of camera is the reason that Nikkon and all other camera companies go the way of Kodak.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Pictures are clear and Video is clear. Battery lasts a long time. If you use the Video feature it tends to drain battery quicker. Used it on a Disney World trip . Fits right in front pocket.
customer_reviews.author: William H. Oconnor

product_meta.title: Nikon Coolpix S9300 16.0 MP Digital Camera - Black (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style:S9300 w/ GPSFROM THE MANUFACTURER



Power and portability blend perfectly into the COOLPIX S9300. Photograph everything from the nightlife in Cancun to the vibrant details of a flower market with the S9300's 18x wide-angle zoom. Create stunning low-light photos without a flash, thanks to its 16.0 megapixel CMOS sensor. Shoot with high-speed framing rates, and record Full HD (1080p) movies at the touch of a button. Plus, built-in GPS provides an accurate and detailed diary of where you've been!


INCREDIBLE REACH AND VERSATILITY
18X OPTICAL ZOOM-NIKKOR ED GLASS LENS
Explore new horizons with a far-reaching 18x zoom. Zoom in to create a colorful still life display of trinkets and charms inside a covered market, then zoom out and frame a stunning wide-angle sunset. The S9300 boasts an 18x optical Zoom-NIKKOR ED glass lens (25–450mm) with optical VR Image Stabilization, which minimizes the chance of blur when shooting photos and movies.

SUPERB LOW-LIGHT SHOOTING
HIGH-RESOLUTION 16.0 MP CMOS SENSOR
The S9300's 16.0 megapixel CMOS sensor expertly manages high-resolution imagery, delivering the exceptional image quality you expect from Nikon. Even when shooting in low light, the photos and movies you create will be so vibrant, they'll transport you back to the instant they were created. Nikon's backside-illuminated CMOS sensor technology increases the flow of light to the sensor's surface, thereby yielding improved image quality and reduced noise.

WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN?
GPS AND ELECTRONIC COMPASS PINPOINT PHOTO AND MOVIE LOCATIONS
Bring bragging rights to your next social network post, and prove to your friends where you’ve been. Track your travels through your photos and movies. With GPS turned on, all your files are instantly geotagged, providing a visual travelogue that pinpoints latitude and longitude. Integrate your geotagged photo and movie files with Nikon's my Picturetown® photo sharing site, Google Earth™ and Nikon ViewNX 2™.



MEMORIES IN MOTION
FULL HD (1080P) MOVIES WITH 18X ZOOM, CONTINUOUS AUTOFOCUS AND STEREO SOUND
Recall the sights and sounds of the nightlife in Cancun or the unique mood of a rain forest. With a single touch of a button, record Full HD (1080p) movies with stereo sound. Continuous autofocus keeps your moving subject in focus, and the S9300's full 18x optical zoom range with two-speed control is available during movie recording. Vary the mood by adding in-camera Special Effects, or capture slow- or fast-motion movies. Then watch your movies on an HDTV via the built-in HDMI port.

ADD YOUR PERSONAL TOUCH
GET CREATIVE WITH IN-CAMERA EFFECTS
Add your personal touch to everything you capture. Apply in-camera special effects such as Low Key, High Key, Nostalgic Sepia, even Selective Color, and put a little variety into images and movies. Bring new creative looks to still images by applying a filter effect like Fisheye or Miniature. The best part: you can instantly share your creations with fellow travelers as they gather around the S9300's large, high-resolution 3.0-inch LCD monitor.


PANORAMAS AT THE TOUCH OF A BUTTON
EASY PANORAMA MODE FOR STUNNING PANORAMIC PHOTOS
Creating expansive panoramic photos has never been easier. Easy Panorama Mode combines multiple shots into a seamless 180° or 360° panoramic image. Begin by focusing on your starting point, then start panning across the scene. Once the S9300 detects your direction, the shooting starts and the images begin stitching together in-camera.
feature_bullets: Full HD (1080p) Movies with Stereo Sound

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars778 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
